definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
phonetic character used in loanwords for the sound "jia", although 夹 is more common
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: He flicked the ashes from his cigar.
On the day of the birth of his first child, he was giving cigars away to all and sundry.
sentences.chinese: 他第一个孩子出生的那天，他向所有的人都敬雪茄烟。

sentences.english: My father allows himself only three cigars a day.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸给自己规定一天只抽三支雪茄烟。

sentences.english: He bought a cigar holder for his father yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸给自己规定一天只抽三支雪茄烟。

sentences.english: Have you ever smoked a cigar?
Yes, I have smoked a cigar.
He likes to smoke mild cigars.
Whenever she got nervous, she would chain-smoked cigars.
sentences.chinese: 每当她感觉紧张时，她会一支接一支不停地抽雪茄烟。

sentences.english: He was wearing a crumpled suit, the front of which was smothered in cigar ash.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿一套揉皱了的衣服，前襟上落满雪茄烟灰。

sentences.english: No, I haven't smoked a cigar.
The other hand held a cigar .
sentences.chinese: 另一支手夹着一支雪茄烟。

sentences.english: Your cigar tinctures the room with an awful smell.
sentences.chinese: 你吸雪茄烟弄得满屋子都是臭味。

sentences.english: There is no one here who likes to smoke a cigar.
sentences.chinese: 这里没有人爱抽雪茄烟的。

sentences.english: Nick sat down against the charred stump and smoked a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 尼克坐在烤成焦炭的树墩上，点了一支雪茄烟。

definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
cigarette lighter plug (inserted in a car's cigarette lighter socket to draw power)
